intro: Terniola, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower heads and silver-gray foliage. Terniola species are typically found in coastal areas, where they thrive in sandy or rocky soils. The plants are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and hardy nature. They play a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion in coastal environments.
